map.item:
In this experiment, your task will be to sort a series of cards as accurately as possible. Each card will have some number of shapes on it, and you can sort each card based on the number of shapes on the card, the color of the shapes, or the shape types (e.g., squares, triangles).
In each trial, you will draw one card (shown in the center of the screen). Sort the card you drew into one of the four piles by using the mouse to highlight one the four decks at the top of the screen, then clicking the left mouse button to sort the card into that deck. After you sort your card, you will be told whether the you sorted that card correctly or incorrectly.
You won't be told how to sort the cards, so you will have to start by guessing which feature of the card is relevant. Use the feedback to figure out where to sort the next card.
Click the left mouse button when you are ready to begin.
